thread.title: Malaysian team emerge as champs in all-girl Dota 2 tournament
thread.title_full: Malaysian team emerge as champs in all-girl Dota 2 tournament

author: Erna Mahyuni
title: Malaysian team emerge as champs in all-girl Dota 2 tournament
text:
Malaysian team emerge as champs in all-girl Dota 2 tournament The team beat out Thailand's DIA 2-1 26 January 2017 / 15:34MYT 
All-Malaysian team Grills Gaming just won the all-girl Female Sea League (FSL) 4 Dota 2 tournament. Not newbies 
Grills Gaming or GG comprise five members: Stephanie "auroraa" Lim, Bette "istarx" Chia, Tiffani "Oling" Lim, Wei Sian "TimunSama" Wong and Nicole "Catosaurus" Lim. 
The girls aren't new to gaming, with the team originally being named Half-Bloods and formed for the Malaysia Cyber Games. 
Previously the players had played in co-ed teams at local tournaments such as Dew Challenge and the Selangor Cyber Games. 
GG won after beating team DIA in the finals, by two matches to one. They brought home Linksys-sponsored routers as well as gaming gear from Creative SoundBlaster. 
Women in e-sports are rare, but it's hoped that tournaments such as this one will encourage more girl gamers to compete.\ 
Keep up with what's happening in the world of cybersports with us here .
